title: Posterior Compartment of Leg, Sole of Foot

questions.question: 1. Which muscle is the most superficial and forms the bulk of the calf in the posterior compartment of the leg?
2. Which deep compartment muscle is primarily responsible for inversion of the foot and supports the medial longitudinal arch?
3. Which muscle in the deep posterior compartment flexes the lateral four toes?
4. Which muscle in the deep posterior compartment is responsible for flexion of the great toe?
5. Which nerve supplies both the posterior compartment of the leg and the sole of the foot?
6. The tibial nerve divides in the ankle region into which two major branches that supply the sole of the foot?
7. Which intrinsic muscle of the sole is primarily responsible for flexion of the lateral four digits?
8. Which intrinsic muscle of the sole plays a key role in maintaining the medial longitudinal arch?
9. What is the primary function of the quadratus plantae muscle?
options: It assists the flexor digitorum longus by adjusting its line of pull.
It supports the lateral longitudinal arch.

questions.question: 10. Which ligament plays a crucial role in supporting the medial longitudinal arch of the foot?
11. Which artery is the primary blood supply to the sole of the foot?
12. Which small muscle, often considered accessory, is part of the superficial posterior compartment and assists in plantarflexion?
13. The Achilles tendon is formed by the convergence of which muscles?
14. Which muscle is NOT part of the posterior compartment of the leg?
15. From which major nerve does the tibial nerve, supplying the posterior compartment, originate?
